title: ARCH 521
names: Advanced Applications in the Built Environment, Architecture and Global Health and Well-Being
intro: This course addresses topics at the intersection of environmental conditions and human health around the globe and engages students in reading, discussing, and applying the results of the latest research and translational studies linking environmental design to health in a range of diverse cultural contexts. Students consider the application of research to everyday practices and decision making, as well as to professional design, planning, and community health practices and engage in a secondary-source research project.
